radiographic_examinations.findings: Uterus measured 8.5 cm by 8.9 cm by 9.6 cm; heterogeneous mass measuring 6.4 cm by 7.8 cm by 8.4 cm with multiple small areas of hypoechogenicity, consistent with cystic changes or necrosis.
Uterus measured 8.9 cm by 9.2 cm by 11.2 cm with a large fibroid measuring 7.2 cm by 7.6 cm by 8.0 cm, including areas of internal hypoechogenicity.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography (CT) of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: One month before the current evaluation
radiographic_examinations.findings: Cystic lesion measuring 7.1 cm by 7.4 cm by 7.4 cm in the uterus thought to represent cystic degeneration.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Size of the mass on CT was similar to previous measurements.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Fibroid measuring 5.6 cm by 6.5 cm by 6.7 cm on left side of the uterus with internal cystic spaces.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Fibroid had decreased in size but had a higher number of cystic components, consistent with large degenerating fibroid.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Hypoechoic lesion measuring 5.2 cm by 5.4 cm by 5.8 cm, probably representing a uterine fibroid.
Mass increased in size to 6.9 cm by 8.8 cm by 10.3 cm with central cystic components; endometrial echocomplex was 4 mm with no pelvic free fluid.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Mass had increased in size since the last study.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Combined positron-emission tomography (PET) and CT scan
radiographic_examinations.findings: Suspicious 1-cm nodule in the upper right lobe of the lung.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Lung nodule has remained stable after 3.5 years of follow-up.
